description: From Latin argillaceus, from argilla (“clay”), from Ancient Greek ἄργιλλος (árgillos, “white clay, potter's earth”), from ἀργός (argós, “white”).

adjectives.description: argillaceous (comparative more argillaceous, superlative most argillaceous)

entries.meaning: (chiefly geology) pertaining to clay; made of, containing, or resembling clay
examples: […]  natural colossi from two to five hundred feet high, done in argillaceous sandstone or a singular species of conglomerate, all of which owe their existence almost entirely to the agency of wind.
